name: v25.11.0-trunk.150
body:
Armbian rolling releases


- rolling releases are available at the bottom of official download pages - How to change type of images that are provided by Armbian? - How to switch between stable and rolling release? Please note that Armbian Rolling Releases are not recommended for production environments, as these builds are not thoroughly tested. However, in most cases, they should work well.

Weekly Digest

  • Add Armbian support for NanoPi R76S. by @SuperKali in armbian/build#8586
  • Add best practices for system upgrades. by @igorpecovnik in armbian/configng#676
  • Add Radxa Rock 4D and Rockchip UFS support. by @HeyMeco in armbian/build#8570
  • Add support for XpressReal T3. by @wei633 in armbian/build#8557
  • allow BTRFS to be built as module. by @tabrisnet in armbian/build#8561
  • armsom-sige5: let uboot use its own dtb for pd negotiation. by @amazingfate in armbian/build#8584
  • Documentation: Adjust size in the menu. by @igorpecovnik in armbian/configng#673
  • Fix, improve and enable distribution upgrade routines. by @igorpecovnik in armbian/configng#669
  • Fixes regression of failing 10Mbit built-in Ethernet in Rockpi S. by @chillymattster in armbian/build#8575
  • Hardening docs for Unstable Upgrades. by @igorpecovnik in armbian/configng#675
  • Hardening of stable release upgrades. by @igorpecovnik in armbian/configng#674
  • patch: rtw88: sdio: fix incorrect RF path detection when MAC is powered off. by @SuperKali in armbian/build#8587
  • Rename keys for distribution upgrade. by @igorpecovnik in armbian/configng#671
  • rockchip64-6.16: update rkvdec driver with HEVC, VDPU38X support. by @amazingfate in armbian/build#8574
  • track input nice value, propagate to docker. by @tabrisnet in armbian/build#8582
